comment: If you participate then you will do well, even if you don't! if you are good at BSing then you're set. I never read but I always spoke in class and participated and I got an A. You should read but PARTICIPATE! That is how she gages whether or not you know what you're talking about (even if you don't)
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Probably 1/3 of my class dropped out. She was really picky about wording and made you work for your grade. I did homework for her class at least 2 hours everyday and still only got a B. She can be mean and is very clear about her opinions.  You must be vocal for this class, she wants people to speak up but you better have the right answer.

Prof Allen's class was easy to pass but difficult to pay attention or go to. Class lectures are solely based on what you read the night before and she will call on people to answer her questions or stop class to wait for someone to answer. Her quizzes and tests were easy if you read. They're just a written 1 page paper on the topic of the chapter!

I loved taking this course! I honestly did not agree with everything that was in the Howard Zinn books (beign im a Republican) however I enjoyed listening and learning new views. This class expanded my horizons in many ways than one! Thanks so much Professor Allen! As long as you read and ATTEND CLASS you will make an A. Make sure to take notes.

I really enjoyed Ms. Allen. I was disappointed to find out that she was not teaching the second part of this class next semester. There is a lot of reading and she makes you work for the answers to her questions, but we had some really interesting discussions in her class. I would 100% take her class again even with how difficult it was.

Professor Allen is a great instructor. The chapters are sometimes long, but the assigned book gives you a different perspective on history. PLEASE complete your readings. She expects full participation from the class. Lectures are actually class discussions. 3 tests in this course: In-class, take home, and final exam.  I'd take her class again.

Be prepared to read two long chapters a week for 2111. Books were ultimately boring. She made us "think critically" all the time - PARTICIPATION COUNTS. Read the chapters or get called out. We've had 2 exams so far and the semester is almost over. Both have been essay exams, one take home.
